high_performers.tweet_text: Joseph of Arimathea took down a corpse. Hands still sticky with blood...
high_performers.why_worked: Combines shocking physical reality with sacred narrative. Creates cognitive dissonance between sanitized Christianity and brutal reality.

high_performers.tweet_text: The more I read the Bible, the more I realize it's actually the best book ever.
high_performers.why_worked: Authenticity over sophistication. High reply rate suggests it sparked personal stories. Works because it's permission to state the obvious.

high_performers.tweet_text: She's kissing His feet. The prostitute is kissing the rabbi's feet. With her mouth. Her hair. Her tears...
high_performers.why_worked: Forces reader to confront scandalous intimacy of biblical grace. Repetition creates discomfort that mirrors Pharisees' reaction.

high_performers.tweet_text: Everything God created, Satan twisted. Sex became porn, Children became burdens, Creation became climate...
high_performers.why_worked: Provides mental framework for understanding chaos. Lists are shareable. Positions audience as diagnosticians.

low_performers.tweet_text: Your pastor just preached to a room full of people planning to ignore everything he said...
low_performers.why_failed: Too pessimistic. Attacks pastors AND congregants. No redemptive arc. Feels like complaint.

low_performers.tweet_text: Someone at church said 'proverbs are the tiktoks of the bible' This is why your church is dying...
low_performers.why_failed: Secondhand outrage feels petty. No solutions. Audience fatigued by church-criticism without redemption.

winning_patterns: Biblical narratives with visceral, physical details
Classical religious art paired with provocative text

optimal_structure.hook: Visceral image OR simple confession OR pattern interrupt
optimal_structure.body: Short sentences (1-3 sentences per paragraph). Progressive revelation. Sensory details.
optimal_structure.tone: Raw + reverent. Honest + hopeful. Diagnostic not despairing.
